==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|すい|そ|yomi=o}}
{{elements|H|||{{ja-r|ヘリウム}}|He|lang=ja|sort=すいそ}}
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}

===Etymology===
{{com|ja|水|素|tr1=sui|t1=[[water]]|tr2=so|t2=[[element]]|sort=すいそ}}, {{cal|ja|nocap=y|etyl lang=nl|etyl term=waterstof|etyl t=[[hydrogen]]; [[waterstuff]]|sort=すいそ}}. Compare {{cog|de|Wasserstoff}}, {{cog|lb|Waasserstoff}}.

Considered to be used first in [[w:Udagawa Yōan|Udagawa Yōan]]'s (宇田川榕菴, 1798 – 1846) book ''Introduction to Chemistry'' (舎密開宗, ''Seimi Kaisō''), a compilation of various scientific books in Dutch.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|y=ko|すいそ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

# [[hydrogen]] {{gloss|chemical element}}
# [[hydrogen]] {{gloss|molecular hydrogen}}
